articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work published in S. Korea
Officials of Iranian embassy visit King Tangun's mausoleum
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's work published in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The February 16 Fellowship Society in South Korea brough out in booklet General Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully Through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation", according to the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation.
   The work is being widely disseminated among people of different social standings.

articles.title: NDFSK calls for satisfying Kwangju uprisers' desire
articles.content:
Officials of Iranian embassy visit King Tangun's mausoleum
  Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Iranian ambassador to Korea Mohammad Ganjidoost and embassy officials on may 18 visited the mausoleum of King Tangun, ancestral father of Korea, in Kangdong county, Pyongyang, to mark a week of Korea-Iran Friendship.
   Being briefed on the fact that the mausoleum was built well as intended by  President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime, the guests went round the monument to the reconstructed mausoleum and chamber of the tomb.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on manhunting in S. Korea
articles.content:
NDFSK calls for satisfying Kwangju uprisers' desire
Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) issued a statement on May 16, two days before the 18th anniversary of the heroic Kwangju popular uprising, Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation said.
   The radio quoted the statement as saying:
   The U.S. fabricated another pro-U.S. dictatorial regime, craftily calling  itself "people's government" in place of "civilian government," and continue colonial rule over South Korea. This is an act trampling down the desire of the May 18 uprisers and a challenge to the South Korean people who are fighting in the spirit of the uprising.
   Though the present regime is styling itself a "people's  government," it has already revealed its true colors as a traitorous regime surpassing the "civilian" dictatorial regime in the anti-democracy, anti-nation and anti-reunification nature.
   The history proves that the desire of the Kwangju uprisers can be realised only through the struggle against the U.S. and the group of pro-U.S. flunkeyists, traitors and fascists.
   All the people should blame the United States, the real tuler of South Korea, for the tragic Kwangju bloodbath, make it apologize for the massacre and put an end to its colonial rule through a powerful anti-U.S. struggle.

articles.title: Jagang Province's achievements in economic construction
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on manhunting in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The South Korean puppets arrested 17 youths, alleging that they formed an "enemy-benefitting" organization called "international socialists" and agitated for "leftist revolution and violent demonstration" at campuses in Seoul.
   This comes under fire in today's edition of Rodong Sinmun.
   In a commentary the daily says:
   The puppets charged that the youths agitated for "violent demonstration and general strike" during a rally held in Seoul on may day and attempted to "radicalize" students and workers.
   Branding workers' May Day rally and demonstration as "violent" is a plot and a far-fetched charge for arresting guiltless people. So, it is nonsense that Ri Tong Gu and others called for "leftist revolution and violent demonstration" on May Day.
   Such a sedition charge can be invented only by those who try hard to brutally suppress workers' struggle for democracy and vital rights.
   The puppets are making desperate efforts to divert elsewhere public resentment against them, only to reveal their true colors as fascists little different from their predecessors.
   The puppets had better know that if they continue suppressing the people's righteous struggle with such a plot which cannot work on the awakened people, they will meet a disgraceful end.

articles.title: New books off the press
articles.content:
Jagang Province's achievements in economic construction
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Jagang Province of Korea is these days making substantial preparations to greet the 50th anniversary of the DPRK as a grand festival of victors. It is situated in the northern inland area of Korea.
   It is registering achievements in the construction of minor hydraulic power stations in order to solve the problem of electricity by its own efforts by availing itself of the characteristics of its region which has steep inclines and abounds in rivers.
   Recently, cities and counties including Janggang, Huichon and Songwon started the operation of more than 20  newly-built minor power stations where thousands of kilowatts of electricity is being produced.
   The province set itself a goal to complete over 60 minor power stations before the 50th anniversary of the DPRK.
   Besides, its local industrial factories expanded the volume of production and introduced advanced technology so as to increase the output of iron, steel, cement and other building materials and daily necessities.
   Particularly, achievements are being made in the work to expand the varieties of consumption goods in cities and counties including Kanggye, Huichon and Janggang.
   2,600 more hectares of pastures were created to open up a bright vista to develop the raising of grass-eating animals.
   The appearance of cities, villages, factories and workplaces is being improved with the promotion of land management and the establishment of cultured ways in production and life.

articles.title: Five-point policy of great national unity supported abroad
articles.content:
New books off the press 
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Many books were recently brought out by Korean publishing houses.
   The literature and art press group published a book "Building of Socialist Cinematic Art,"  the first volume of "Library of Juche-based Theory on Cinematics" which consummates General Kim Jong Il's theory on cinematic art.
   It also released a collection of literary works "Cheers of History," a collection of lyrics "Image of Great Man," a collection of epics "A Great Teacher" and a full-length novel "Vernal Sky"  which depicts the activities of a woman revolutionary in the countryside.
   A full-length novel "A Snowy Pass," a collection of poems of Korean women poets in Japan "Vernal Fragrance" and other literary books are to be published.
   The working people's organisations publishing house will publish a note of a repatriate from Japan "In the Bosom of the Homeland" and other books.
   The sports publishing house brought out a book "Football Games for 'World Cup,'"  which arouses people's interest and will shortly release a book of common sense "Sports Events and Their Origin."

articles.title: Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Five-point policy of great national unity supported abroad
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Organisations and public figures of different countries published statements in support of General Kim Jong Il's historic letter "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully Through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation."
   The Romania-Korea Friendship Association in a statement said that the South Korean authorities should sincerely respond to his five-point policy of great national unity, give up the policy of dependence on outside forces and take a true stand toward national reunification.
   The youth group for the study of the Juche idea of Democratic Congo in a statement expressed full support to the five-point policy, noting that if the entire Korean nation in the north, south and abroad is to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country through great national unity, it is  a matter of primary importance to thoroughly maintain the Juche character and the national character.
   The All-India agricultural workers union in a statement stressed that the cherished desire of the Korean people to build an independent unified state with the five-point policy will be realized without fail.
   Vasile Budriga, Chairman of the Romanian National Committee for Solidarity with the Korean People's Struggle for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country, in a press statement said that the letter gives all the Korean people and the world people the conviction and courage that the reunification of Korea may be realized in a peaceful way.
   Hassan Abdel Salam, Secretary General of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, in a press statement noted that the Korean people will achieve the great unity of the entire nation  and reunify the country independently and peacefully in accordance with the five-point policy of great national unity.
   Prof. and dr. Georgi Stoyanov, Chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, in a press statement stated that the public circles of Bulgaria, together with the progressive people of the world, positively support the five-point policy.

articles.title: Greetings to Russian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
 Pyongyang, May 19  (KCNA) -- There are schoolchildren's palaces, extracurricular centres, in various parts of Korea. 
   The Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace situated at Kwangbok Street in Pyongyang is one of them.
   The palace covers a total area of 250,000 square metres. 
   It has more than 200 rooms for arts, crafts and technical hobby groups and sports groups. There are 60 rooms for technical hobby groups such as computer, electronics and astronomy.
   The palace is visited by 5,000 primary and senior middle school pupils every day.   After school, they engage in activities according to their aptitudes.
   The astronomy study group study the planets and outer space using the latest equipment.
   In the sports groups the members get training in basketball, table-tennis and football. They take part in various sports programmes and events, achieving good results.
   Members of the arts group have free access to electronic musical instruments, accordion and other instruments. It is worthy to note that some talented members were given opportunities to give performances in Spain, France and Japan in the past.
   Through these after-school activities in this palace, many pupils have developed into noted scientists, technicians and creative and performing artists.
